result.execSummary:
The defendant Neil Jay Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Injunction Petitioner [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1m)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing October 30, 2015.
10-30-15/ Rebecca F Dallet
Court ordered restitution set at $0

Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA smalpe, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit for 27 days.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing 09-18-2015 received and filed. (22 Pages.)  CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION.

Defendant Neil Jay Brown in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Neil Jay Brown in custody and appeared via video conference.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Resitution hearing held.  State has not received any information from the victim.  Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.
Check request X262135 Forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $72.00 paid to PARK EAST HOTEL, invoice # 129,  for witness DS copy in file.
Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Neil Jay Brown in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Neil Jay Brown in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 37 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with any other sentence; credit for 27 days served.  Court ordered 13 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
- Restitution to be set at a hearing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence with credit for 27 days time served.  
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 1:30 pm.
Defendant was not produced from prison for sentencing.  Case rescheduled to 9/18/15 at 8:30 am.   rmm

Defendant Neil Jay Brown in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Neil Jay Brown in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for Kristin Schrank for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 40.
Pursuant to negotiations, court deletes REPEATER enhancers.
As to both counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Defendant remanded pending sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Neil Jay Brown not in court, in custody.  Matthew Torbenson for Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed.  Defense has not seen the video yet as the one they received from the state did not work.  Case passed.
Order to Produce for Jury Trial on August 19, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Neil Jay Brown not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Defendant was not produced from prison.  Court ordered trial adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Neil Jay Brown in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Neil Jay Brown in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/17/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Neil Jay Brown not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for Plea/sentencing hearing however, Defense requests Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial Dates. Case adjourned.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Neil Jay Brown in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Neil Jay Brown in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Joseph Wasserman, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DENISE S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Neil Jay Brown in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Neil Jay Brown in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
